json.schema:
<prop type="array" name="bareMetalMachineConfigurationData">
<prop type="array" name="storageApplianceConfigurationData">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="availableUpgradeVersions" identifiers="targetClusterVersion">
<prop type="array<@RackDefinition_read>" name="computeRackDefinitions" identifiers="networkRackId">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="workloadResourceIds">

command.name: delete
command.confirmation: Are you sure you want to perform this operation?

json.schema:
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="additionalInfo">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array<@ErrorDetail_read>" name="details" identifiers="message target">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array<@OperationStatusResult_read>" name="operations">

help.short: The extended location of the cluster manager associated with the cluster.
The resource ID of the extended location on which the resource will be created.
The extended location type, for example, CustomLocation.

The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.
The geo-location where the resource lives

json.schema:
<userAssigned action="create" type="array" name="userAssigned" arg="$clusterParameters.identity.userAssigned">
<prop type="array" name="bareMetalMachineConfigurationData" arg="@RackDefinition_create.bareMetalMachineConfigurationData">
<prop type="array" name="storageApplianceConfigurationData" arg="@RackDefinition_create.storageApplianceConfigurationData">
<prop type="array<@RackDefinition_create>" name="computeRackDefinitions" arg="$clusterParameters.properties.computeRackDefinitions" identifiers="networkRackId">

<prop type="array" name="bareMetalMachineConfigurationData">
<prop type="array" name="storageApplianceConfigurationData">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="availableUpgradeVersions" identifiers="targetClusterVersion">
<prop type="array<@RackDefinition_read>" name="computeRackDefinitions" identifiers="networkRackId">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="workloadResourceIds">

help.short: The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.
The Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones.

json.schema:
<userAssigned action="create" type="array" name="userAssigned" arg="$clusterUpdateParameters.identity.userAssigned">
<prop type="array" name="bareMetalMachineConfigurationData" arg="@RackDefinition_update.bareMetalMachineConfigurationData">
<prop type="array" name="storageApplianceConfigurationData" arg="@RackDefinition_update.storageApplianceConfigurationData">
<prop type="array<@RackDefinition_update>" name="computeRackDefinitions" arg="$clusterUpdateParameters.properties.computeRackDefinitions" identifiers="networkRackId">

<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="workloadResourceIds">
